intro: Aphelandra wasshausenii, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves with a waxy, yellow-green surface and its clusters of fragrant, spathiflorous flowers. It thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-draining soil. Aphelandra wasshausenii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and air-purifying properties.
